Title: Best mobile game ever!
Content: This game is great if you wanna open packs for free, and you get to build decks and enter tournaments and completions!

Title: The Booster Packs
Content:
This game is actually very addictive, mostly when you‚Äôve just started playing it because you get the opportunity to build up your cards and the element of surprise is there. I enjoy the random battle gameplay very much, there‚Äôs never a long wait time to battle someone online. The battles are fun but also strategic - makes you think carefully about how you play The Pok√©mon cards and use their attacks. It‚Äôs a good mental game also I‚Äôd say.
My cons? I think it takes a while for them to update the game in terms of online events and challenges and at a point you find yourself playing the game less than usual. I guess if you were to look at it from a different angle, I guess the game gives you time to touch grass also than playing constantly. lol. My greatest problem with the game really are the booster packs. I find them to be very repetitive. Like why do I have 15 Raticate cards??It‚Äôs very rare to actually select a good booster back, you mostly just get cards you already have which can be annoying. It‚Äôs also very slow building booster packs for 10 packs opening which can be dreading. 
All in all, I actually do love the game, just would like some more updates.

Title: Hello people. Don‚Äôt get angry at me for saying this.
Content: So the coin flip, people say it‚Äôs rigged but I disagree (sometimes). I had 4 coins to flip and 3 of them were heads (that‚Äôs unrealistic in life). I think the game was really well made. Not pay to win at all. The illustrations are beautiful! And the packs‚Ä¶welll‚Ä¶.the mew pack gives me good things. I got a jump into art celibi from that. But‚Ä¶the other packs just give me rattatata straight. I get so ticked when I get 4 rattatata from one normal pack and then a Pidgey. But then I get TWO garadoseEX from one mew pack. What? So be aware the normal packs can be a little rigged. I‚Äôm happy that they improved the pay thing. It‚Äôs not pay to win, no pay needed. If you play POK√âMON UNITE and play This then you can see the difference.

Title: Janky, feels worse than most Indie games
Content:
I don‚Äôt know what it is about the Pok√©mon franchise, but you need a serious tech update. It‚Äôs not like y‚Äôall don‚Äôt have any money, but it always feels that way. 

I guess it could be cultural, I‚Äôve heard that Japan has a problem with always capitulating to seniors in a corporation, and it does feel like this game was implemented by people who peaked 30 years ago. 

Bad, outdated UX conventions, tons of time-wasting and boring screens, boring or noisy UI design, and extremely sub-par development implementation. I haven‚Äôt played a game that felt so janky for a long time and Pok√©mon isn‚Äôt a no-name brand. 

It‚Äôs pretty fun, but the app is aesthetically unpleasant in almost every way. If I want to play Pok√©mon in an ugly ill-equipped place I‚Äôll go to the local game store.

Title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD

Title: Battles are too simple
Content: The general concept is fun but the battling is (like the main series game) is way too simplistic, leading to incredibly frustrating situations in which the outcome of the battle is essentially decided before any actual action happens. If you start first, you‚Äôre already fighting at a massive disadvantage.

Content: i personally really like this game, everyone saying it‚Äôs impossible to play the game free to play is just straight wrong. i have not spent a cent on this game and i have 2 celebi illustrations, a celebi full art, and plenty of other full arts and exs. i think it is a pretty great game. it is entirely possible to play this game free. u have another friend who plays and he has illustration cards and even a crown mew and he too has spent nothing on the game. anyone mad just expects everything to be handed to them. only reason i did not give it 5 stars is that i‚Äôm annoyed it‚Äôs limited to 2 packs a day without a good source of hourglasses.

Title: No chance
Content: No way the coin toss odds are 50-50. I will play like 5 games in a row and never get an ideal coin toss. Makes the game so frustrating to watch a Celebi player get 12 heads and hit me for 600 but I can‚Äôt even one head just once to do an extra 40 damage.

Title: Not worth battling
Content:
Nice cards detail. Overall the battling aspect of this game is absolutely trash. Mewto is way too over used most matches are just people using mew. Also why be able to have friends if you cannot 1 rematch them 2talk/ emote or anything or anything at all. might as well take it out the game and then just add that whole feature into the game in a future update makes no sense at all. 

Being said that the battling aspect of this game is the main issue what else is there to do? Once you collect your one pack in the morning last pack at night and if ur lucky get a third pack mid day. That‚Äôs pretty much your left with collecting 3 to 2 packs a day and if you‚Äôre already gassed out by trying to battle with new unique decks 85% of people are spamming Mew,pikachu and , articuno misty . All 3 turn game winning decks. SOOOO BORINGGGGGGGGGGG.

Title: No guaranteed reward system and too high variance between players
Content: I want to leave a negative review for this game because even with full participation in the events, you still may not obtain certain event cards. The variance between players is too high. Game developers shouldn‚Äôt treat players this way; there should be a guaranteed reward system. Instead of making players feel disappointed time and time again, which eventually leads to resentment toward the game.

Not pvp tho, Celebi spammers and Articuno EX and Vaporeon duos are flooded. Doesn‚Äôt even matter if you even have any fire types I got whooped by a guy with 2 EX Celebi‚Äôs

Title: Great game, but play flaws
Content:
I enjoy the Pok√©mon TCG very much and will continue playing it! However, there are some points of contention when playing: 

1. When an opponent concedes, there is no penalty. It discourages me from playing Online matches.
SOLUTION: Devs should show opponent‚Äôs quit rate to players

2. The game needs more avenues for discarding duplicate cards:

SOLUTIONS:
a. Exchange duplicates > Shop Tokens: 3 dupes for 50 dust, or equivalent for rarity ( EX cards> Black shop token)
b. Exchange > Card packs
c. Exchange > Wonder Picks

3. Allow players to Create Decks from the ‚ÄúSolo/Versus‚Äù. Battle pages

Title: Fine Base, But Needs Work
Content:
This seems like the kinda app that‚Äôs really fun for like maybe a month and then gets boring.  Each pack only has 5 cards and they don‚Äôt even have a guaranteed rare or anything like that, so eventually you get the the point where you‚Äôre bored of the 1-2 competitive decks you can play with, and it‚Äôs been weeks since you‚Äôve opened a playable card that you don‚Äôt have yet (or a card that you don‚Äôt have yet, period)

You can get 1 of the in game store currency per battle for 5 battles, then nothing, so there isn‚Äôt even an in game incentive to keep playing. I‚Äôve reached the point where the only reason I still have this on my phone is because it‚Äôs pretty new and they could make it more playable, but compared to similar games like mtg arena, I just don‚Äôt see myself sticking around unless they make playing feel more worthwhile.

Title: All Good Things Must Come to an End
Content: The game is addicting and fun. It‚Äôs very easy to invest money into it, here and there, to grab every card; however, at some point, the game prevents you from getting new cards, and even winning battles, to make you want to play more. For me, it‚Äôs the opposite. I spent a lot of money to get all the cards, to no avail. You‚Äôll get lucky, time and time again, but eventually, it‚Äôs rigged against you. It‚Äôs a fun one, and the cards are cool and even nostalgic; however, it‚Äôs a broken system that should reward long term players, especially those that spend a lot of money.

Title: Quite enjoyable
Content:
No ads. No pay to win. The battles work well. Even got to play with irl friends, although I like playing the AI. The structure allows me to play at the difficulty I prefer and challenge myself at my own pace.

Update as of January:  I‚Äôve been playing it since release at end of October. I‚Äôm not playing it much anymore as of this week. This is because there is only one division battle in. There needs to be a featherweight and a heavyweight division. Only allowing non EX Pok√©mon in the featherweight. The thing is that all we ever see in battles anymore are the same optimal set ups of decks.  It is boring. It makes it so that you yourself can not use your favorite Pok√©mon. You have no choice but to use the same optimal setups that everyone else is using. I want to enjoy some fights using the lower tier Pok√©mon and a variety of Pok√©mon.  I really liked it the first few weeks. Oh well.

Title: Meta cards and decks ruin the fun
Content: Would be a 5/5 star game but the multiplayer is so unbelievably frustrating. You are forced to use a meta deck and can‚Äôt really have fun with other decks because everyone is using the few meta decks that are. practically unbeatable unless you are running direct counters. Mad disappointing, need more than just a 3 point system and more cards that make other non meta cards more playable. Card collecting is fun just needs more packs and trading.

Title: Battling
Content: Battling requires zero skill and is all luck based. Would love if I could stop going first against rival decks. It‚Äôs infuriating to see my opponent get every single card they need flawlessly while I struggle to even get anything set up. RNG is strong in this game and it‚Äôs either with you or against you. Hope there‚Äôs some changes made to the battling

Title: Why is this so highly rated?
Content: I‚Äôve played this game for the last few months now, I have 1,600 cards and most of both decks completed. For a multi-trillion dollar company they can‚Äôt even make a mobile card game right the fact that there are only like 500 cards in the game and I‚Äôve pulled over 1k without getting all of the normal cards with no crazy art on them is just ridiculous. You will reach a wall in this game where there is no point in even collecting because no matter how many you collect there is nothing to do with the extras and and you won‚Äôt ever get all the cards. Also the battles aren‚Äôt fun because there are no card varieties yet everyone is running the same decks of cards and if they get 1 sign of losing the game they concede and then you do it over again. I‚Äôm not wanting to dog in this crappy game, I truly wish it was good but I can‚Äôt find fun in it. I‚Äôd rather them have made this game a nft game at least then maybe I could have made money off my time wasted pulling packs for the last few months.

Title: Imbalanced cash grab
Content: Game is poorly balanced, and card acquisition system slowly funnels you towards spending money. Initially the game gives you lots of packs to open, but this slows down quickly. Packs are about $1 each, and drop rates are so abysmal you could easily open 100 packs without seeing anything interesting.

Title: Try For Free
Content:
Free-to-play community is currently thriving.

Bad strategies can be a definitive loss.
Luck can beat perfectly-executed strategy.
Pay-to-win helps. 
Players can stall.
(these may seem obvious, but there are similar games which have none of them)
